heading: Bharat Benz taps used commercial vehicle market with new exchange program
summary: 'bharatbenz Exchange' will provide buyers with a carefully-picked pool of used trucks that have undergone thorough quality checks. The truckmaker will also support used vehicle buyers (both individuals and companies) with large portfolio of vehicles suitable to their application by providing the right AMC and Extended Warranty options for their range of refurbished trucks. They will assist in identifying the appropriate financing partner. Ev buyers will be able to exchange their used vehicles of any brand for new or used british vehicles.

heading: Delhi's electric vehicle policy announced: What it means for EV buyers
summary: The new electric vehicle policy aims at boosting the economy, reducing pollution, and encourages usage of e-vehicles for the next three years. The state government announced that the Delhi government will give a benefit of up to Rs 30,000 and for four-wheeler, the benefit is 1.5 lakh. In the near future the open-permit system for electric autos in Delhi will promote zero-emission last and the first-mile green mobility.

heading: Kia Sonet revealed: A winner again
summary: The Kia Sonet compact SUV looks like a ‘baby’ Seltos. The headlights are cool too thanks to the uniquely shaped LED DRL. The front bumper also gets scuff plates and also houses fog lights. At the back the sonet’s design is even more appealing. Led tail lights mimic the design of the headslamps. This makes it look wider and imposing. Spot on with the designs.

heading: Kia Sonet breaks cover; to rival Maruti Suzuki Vitara Brezza, Hyundai Venue
summary: The sonet is Kia Motors India's third offering in the country after the Seltos and the Carnival. The automaker claims that the prototypes of the 'kia Sonet' have been tested for more than 1 lakh km on the Indian roads. We first saw the concept form at the Auto Expo 2020, but it must be added here that it looks equally awe-inspiring, if not more. It will be exported to other countries.

heading: Kia Sonet debut today; price, features, specs, other details you should know
summary: Kia Motors India is set to unveil its third product for the Indian market today which will be a sub-4m compact SUV offering. The Sonet first made an appearance at the 2020 Auto Expo in february albeit in concept form. It will have its world premiere today followed by commencement of bookings over the coming weeks ahead of its launch in September. We already know that the exterior features will include LED DRLs, LED tail lights and kia’s signature ‘tiger nose’ grille.

heading: Tata Nexon EV now available at monthly subscription of Rs 41,900
summary: The new electric vehicle subscription programme makes available the Tata Nexon EV to the customers at an all-inclusive fixed monthly rental starting at Rs 41,900. The automaker is initially offering the service in Delhi/NCR, Mumbai, Pune, Hyderabad and Bengaluru. Once the subscription tenure is over, the customer can either choose to extend it or just return the vehicle. A new subscription model allows customers to choose between three separate tenures -- 36 months, 24 months and 18 months.

heading: 2020 Maruti Suzuki S-Cross: 5 things you should know
summary: The 2020 maruti Suzuki S-Cross has finally been launched in India. The automaker had initially planned to introduce the vehicle in March - but the launch had to be postponed. Now that it is here, it has again taken the position of the flagship product in Nexa's portfolio. Despite the Covid-19 pandemic, the launches have been delayed and it will be announced in january. There are five important things you should know about it.

heading: Jawa, Jawa Forty Two: Price-colour combination explained

They sit on a double-cradle frame, with telescopic hydraulic fork, 18-inch tyre and 280mm disc/153 drum.

heading: New Audi RS Q8 bookings open in India for Rs 15 lakh
summary: The new Audi RS Q8 can be booked at any Audi India dealership or official company website for an initial amount of Rs 15 lakh. It is the fastest series production SUV on the Nurburgring, but also the most powerful SUV coupe from the Audi family. A V8 twin-turbo, 4.0-litre, TFSI petrol engine that develops 600hp. This is an epitome of performance and aggressive styling.

heading: Buying a used Royal Enfield? Here are five things you need to watch out for
summary: Royal Enfield was one of the brands which revived itself from the brink of extinction. Now the company has become the heartthrob in the nation and the used bike market is thriving - but not many can afford a new one. In this story we will tell you what all to watch out for so that you can buy yourself one good example. The Bullet 350 and Classic 350 sport classic mudguard designs, while the Classic range sport more rounded off units.

heading: New 2020 helmet norms announced by MoRTH: Explained
summary: The ministry repealed its previous ban on the sale of helmets that weigh more than 1200gm(1.2kg) allowing foreign players to stock and sell in the market from September 4th 2020 as long as the helmet manufacturer met current ISI standards. Now, extrapolating on existing norms, MoRTH has announced an additional ban - all players must be certified by the ISi under the BIS Act, 2016. The rules are set to come into play on 31 March 2021.

summary: Nissan has announced its intention to enter the highly lucrative sub-4m compact SUV space with the upcoming Nissan Magnite. The car maker?s current line up comprises just two vehicles Kicks and GT-R, while the company isn?t exactly planning a product offensive over the coming year or two, it will be launching its new compact crossover space in the next few years - the new model is expected to be released in january. If you have any questions, please contact the Nissan Motor Corporation.

heading: Maruti Suzuki S-Cross Petrol vs Hyundai Creta vs Kia Seltos vs Renault Duster vs Nissan Kicks: Specifications Comparison
summary: The new maruti Suzuki S-Cross petrol replaces the outgoing diesel version of the NEXA flagship product. It will be the only engine option on offer in the Indian market, but what we would like to address here is how it stacks up against its rivals in terms of price. The carmaker announced its official launch at a starting price of Rs 8.39 lakh (ex showroom, India) the 2020 update features minor cosmetic changes both on the outside and the inside.

heading: BS6 KTM 250 Duke launched in India, price starts at Rs 2.09 lakh
summary: The new BS6 KTM 250 Duke is powered by a single-cylinder, 4-valve, liquid-cooled, DOHC, 248.8cc engine that delivers 30PS of maximum power and 24Nm of peak torque. summary: The 2020 Mahindra Thar has been spied testing on numerous occasions in india. It will come with standard safety features like dual front airbags, ABS with EBD, seat belt reminder, reverse parking assist and high-speed alert. The diesel option might be in the form of a 140bhp 2.2-litre mHawk turbo powertrain. An automatic transmission is also expected with both the mills.

heading: Tata Motors refute reports about selling stake in PV business
summary: Tata Motors denies selling up to 49 per cent stake in its domestic passenger vehicle (PV) business. The company says it's not an imperative for today but an opportunity to be secured for tomorrow. It also clarifies that it does not have any such plans in the near future either. A cash improvement programme of Rs 6,000 crore has been called out to the capital expenditure for FY21, which is expected to cost around Rs 1,500 crore for the year 2020.

heading: 2020 Maruti Suzuki S-Cross launched in India, price starts at Rs 8.39 lakh
